Monday - Friday / 11 am to 1 pm

Only 1 person at the pick up table

Please wait at the sign posted outside of cafeteria door until the person in front of you receives their bags and exits the table.

Keep a distance of at least 6 feet from others while in line

No One is Permitted inside Cafeteria other than District Authorized Staff

Parent / Guardian questions should be directed to: Lisa Martel: lmartel@freshpickscafe.com.

Be well. And be deliberative in helping to avoid the spread of the virus.

At the end of their day, 428 students in grades one to four exited Highbridge School, and relocated to the high school where buses and parents picked them up at dismissal.
Staff members stayed late, parents came at their regular time, and the students were no less than outstanding in their cooperation!

This was our first attempt to ensure we have adequate procedures in place to keep your children safe under any circumstance, and we were very pleased with the results.

Safety will always be out top priority! We'll continue to examine our procedures and refine where necessary!

Today in Mrs. Salmonson's Honors U.S. History class community member, Randy Kangas, shared the story of his uncle, Leonard Kangas. Leonard Israel Kangas grew up in New Ipswich and was an Appleton Academy basketball star and graduate. After high school, he joined the U.S. Navy and served on an aircraft carrier, the U.S.S. Wasp during World War II. On September 15, 1942 during the Battle of Guadalcanal, the Wasp was hit by Japanese torpedoes. Storekeeper, Third Class Kangas did not make it home. He was one of 176 deaths that day on the Wasp, but the only New Ipswich World War II casualty. Thank you Mr. Kangas for taking the time to share your uncle's legacy.

Mrs. Salmonson's slideshow presentation about Leonard Kangas: https://drive.google.com/file/d/103_nXK-VLyk23zLFMTd_7axI5C3rZ25E/view
